tasks: Review Tesler's Law (https://lawsofux.com/teslers-law/) and create a simple diagram illustrating how it applies to your current projects. Score improvement: +5% in UX Fundamentals

Identify 3 common design patterns that can lead to cognitive overload (e.g., too many options, complex layouts) and write a short paragraph explaining why they're problematic. Score improvement: +2% in UX Fundamentals

Apply the Aesthetic-Usability Effect (https://lawsofux.com/aesthetic-usability-effect/) to redesign a simple UI element (e.g., button, input field) you've worked on in the past. Score improvement: +5% in UX Fundamentals

Conduct a self-assessment of your current design process and identify 2 areas where you can improve the user research and validation phase. Create a brief plan to address these gaps. Score improvement: +3% in User Research & Validation

Create a simple heuristic evaluation of your current portfolio's navigation using the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (https://www.nngroup.com/articles/ten-usability-heuristics/). Score improvement: +5% in UX Fundamentals

Develop a basic understanding of Hick’s Law (https://lawsofux.com/hicks-law/) and explain how it applies to your current design work. Write a short paragraph illustrating the concept. Score improvement: +2% in UX Fundamentals

Design a comprehensive user research plan for a new product idea, incorporating the Jobs-to-be-Done framework and focusing on understanding user motivations. Score improvement: +8% in User Research & Validation

Create a high-fidelity wireframe of a complex UI element (e.g., dashboard, settings panel) that incorporates principles from Product Thinking & Strategy. Score improvement: +6% in Product Thinking & Strategy

resources.readup: As a UX practitioner, your skills are a great foundation for growth. Focus on building upon your strengths in user research and validation to drive more effective design solutions, while also working to bridge the gaps in product thinking and strategy to unlock your full potential as a designer.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Hick’s Law and its Impact on UX Design
topics.summary: Applying Hick's Law to design intuitive navigation and minimize cognitive load for users.
practice_points: Conduct an analysis of 3 existing websites using Hick’s Law as a guiding principle, identifying areas where the law is applied or neglected. Document findings in a report.

topics.name: Developing Aesthetic-Usability Effect through Visual Design
topics.summary: Creating visually appealing designs that minimize cognitive load and enhance user experience.
practice_points: Design 3 wireframes for a hypothetical product, incorporating the Aesthetic-Usability Effect to guide visual design decisions. Present findings in a presentation.

topics.name: Applying Tesler’s Law to Improve Information Architecture
topics.summary: Using Tesler's Law to optimize information organization and reduce cognitive load for users.
practice_points: Analyze the information architecture of 2 existing websites, applying Tesler’s Law to identify areas for improvement. Create a proposed redesign and present it in a report.
